abstracts.cdata!:
The main development objective of the
            Provincial Agricultural Development Project (PROSAP) for
            Argentina is to increase and diversify agricultural
            production and exports. This Indigenous Peoples Plan (IPP) /
            Diagnostico socio-economico y cultural de la colonia
            aborigen Chaco : plan de desarrollo indígena, evaluated
            impacts as follows : land acquisition and social assessment
            policies and practices; evaluated indigenous peoples (IPs)in
            the area of influence of the project, reviewed their
            cultural heritage and established guidelines that will
            ensure that their rights, including their dignity and
            cultural identity are respected; traditional forms of
            leadership among the indigenous organizations; sanitary
            installations; ethnics relations among IPs and criollos;
            loss of fishing and hunting sources; loss of pastures and
            vegetation; schools and health facilities; deterioration of
            feeder roads and bridges. This IPP document recommends
            mitigation measures as follows : guarantee indigenous
            peoples participation throughout the implementation and
            monitoring of the project; executing agencies will respect
            cultural and religious sites; government, local institutions
            and consultants working for these institutions will include
            indigenous peoples (IPs) in all activities of the project,
            including preparation, design, execution and evaluation of
            subprojects; organize community awareness campaigns to
            inform IPs progress of project implementation; promote a
            participatory approach among rural indigenous communities;
            develop an institutional strengthening plan for the
            indigenous organizations and the ethnics groups within the
            (Colonia Aborigen Chaco)) the area of influence of the
            project; establish a system to monitor the quality of
            drinking water; and finally, propose an implementation plan
            for better communication and dissemination of information
            between the Provincial Estate government and the indigenous organizations.
